DOC.brief_summary: Epidemiological study show inverse association coffee consumption risk type 2 diabetes mellitus ( T2DM ) . However experimental study analyse mechanisms limit . This project aim assess effect coffee consumption glucose metabolism , use stable isotope tracer ( 13C-glucose ) explain possible metabolic mechanism involve reduced risk T2DM .
DOC.detailed_description: This crossover randomize clinical trial study 14 male healthy young adult , enrol five treatment : coffee sugar , coffee without sugar , decaffeinate coffee without sugar two control ( water without sugar ) . The stable isotope minimal model protocol oral glucose administration ( Oral Dose Intravenous Label Experiment - ODILE ) perform . The use ODILE methodology permit separation glucose absorb remove circulation increase accuracy effectiveness glucose uptake insulin sensitivity ( Bluck et al. , 2006 ) .
DOC.criteria: Male healthy young adult ( 18 50 year old ) ; Body mass index ( BMI ) 18.5 28.0 kg/m² ; No weight change ( ≥ 5 kg ) last 3 month ; Not take pills/drugs alter metabolism , appetite sleep ; Not sleep disorder ; Not donate blood last 3 month ; Regular breakfast consumption ( ≥100 kcal ingest 2 hour wake ≥4x/week ) ; Being habitual coffee consumer ( ≥100mL ≥5x/week ) . Diagnosis anemia , metabolic heart diseases ; Previous sudden fainting convulsion ; Any drug tobacco consumption ; Consumption 500mg caffeine / day ( 5 cup coffee , tea cola soft drink ) .
